result.execSummary:
The defendant Aron A Gilbert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Imposed and Stayed.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3.5 years bifurcated sentence.
Imposed and Stayed.  Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
No alcohol or controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Defendant is not to have any addictive substances of any kind, even with a prescription.

Defendant is to sign medical release to allow agent access to medical and prescription records.  Agent is to approve all prescriptions.  Defendant must attend 7 self-help meetings per week when not employed, and 5 meetings per week when employed, and provide signed proof of attendance.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aron A Gilbert

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Def does not plan to seek postconviction relief.

Defendant Aron A Gilbert in court with attorney Erin Joy Larsen.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
Plea:  Ct. 1 w/o RO - NC.
BTC:  Ct. 1 - GUILTY.  Ct. 2 - DRI.  PSI ordered.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Aron A Gilbert in court with attorney Erin Joy Larsen.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.  req. Feb COP date  Plea hearing scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Aron A Gilbert in court with attorney Erin Joy Larsen.  Defendant Aron A Gilbert in custody.  Randall Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Status conference scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Aron A Gilbert not in court.  W Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.
Deft just got taken into custody within the last hour.
BTC: Matter adjourned.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with victim store, Pearl Vision, except for restitution purposes.   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Aron A Gilbert in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Defendant Aron A Gilbert in custody.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set. BTC: WARRANT VACATED  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Restitution request - provided by Victim Witness. VI-Pearle Vision $912.90
Warrant walked through by the DA's office and delivered to RPD for immediate entry.
